title: Qualitative Research and Strategic Design for Absorptive Capacity (AC) Development in Public Academic Libraries

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of library operations or knowledge management, foundational knowledge of organizational learning concepts
context.additional_context: Learners experience absorption capacity development strategies in a virtual library environment through VR simulations, collaborating and being assessed via personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three components of absorptive capacity (AC) in public academic libraries (individual/organizational levels).
Design a procedure to analyze AC influencing factors using qualitative research methods (in-depth interviews, grounded theory).
Apply AC development strategies (e.g., transitioning to a learning organization, fostering innovation) to real-world cases through VR simulation.

resources: MAXQDA or similar qualitative analysis tools

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
